gave me an error popup telling me it couldn't complete which I would expect.  I 
hit undo but it seems to have done everything but remove the directory I had a 
command prompt in.  It also gave me the following exception:

Moving to JDT UI for comments

RC2

I found the same problem, slightly different scenario.  Open a file (in my 
case, a PowerPoint presentation *.ppt) from the Package Explorer.  Modify it 
outside of Eclipse.  Keep PowerPoint open.  Now attempt to rename the file.  
See the error message displayed and a couple internal errors that are added to 
the log.

Created an attachment (id=12524)
Error Log exceptions

There are three different issues:

- the fact that the target directory is locked by an external command prompt.
  There is no way how we can detect this in Eclipse, so the operation will
  always fail. But I agree that the error message could be improved.

- the fact that the file you want to rename is locked by an external program.
  This can't be detected either using normal Eclipse/JDK API.

- the fact that the resource is out of sync. This is clearly a bug and should
  be addressed. I looked over the code and this only happens for resource in 
  the package explorer. Renaming Java element does treat this correctly.

I agree with all your facts.  I don't think it is a good idea to log three 
errors for what will be a common user mistake, that's all.  The platform 
should catch them, inform the user, and move on.

The initial defect I submitted here has been fixed.  I can't speak to cases 2
and 3 from Dirk's comment.
Seeting to won't fix. We shouldn't automatically refresh a file. Other funtionaly also doesn't do that.
